p: Fig 2 summarizes the distribution of viral infection rates within the four age groups. Viral infection was more frequent in G1group (76.88% of the 372 tested samples). RV, RSVA/B, CoVs group and MPVA/B were predominant within patients from G1 and G3 groups, while BoV, InfVs group, and EV were most frequently detected in patients belonging to G1 and G4 age groups. PIVs infection was most commonly described in patients aged from 7 to 12 months (G3 group). AdV infection was age-dependent (p<0.05), and was more frequent in children below 2 years old (results not shown). PeV was more frequent in children less than 4 months of age.
